channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A SpaceX IPO could be the largest public offering of all time—and Elon Musk’s biggest headache
item.description: Musk’s space company had avoided much of the scrutiny, criticism, and regulatory burden that comes with going public.

item.title: How Trump’s anti-DEI policies are hurting Black workers
item.description: When the government shutdown came to an end last month, the much-delayed jobs report for September was finally released, revealing that the unemployme...

item.title: Ford is canceling the F-150 Lightning in a major EV pullback, but don’t count U.S. electric vehicles out yet
item.description: The country’s automotive future doesn’t look as electric as carmakers had once hoped. But it doesn’t mean the EV industry is entirely dead. On Monday,...

item.title: Top Whiskey Reviewers Say This New (And Affordable) Bottle From Jack Daniels Is the Best of 2025
item.description: Breaking Bourbon released its full review of the bottle.

item.title: Hyundai and Kia to offer free anti-theft repairs for millions of cars under a multistate settlement
item.description: Automakers Hyundai and Kia must offer free repairs to millions of models under a settlement announced Tuesday by Minnesota’s attorney general, who led...

item.title: Google researchers unlock some truths about getting AI agents to actually work
item.description: The researchers found single AI agents do better at sequential tasks, multi-agent workflows at ones that can be done in parallel

item.title: These ‘historical tours’ of modern offices capture just how banal work is

item.title: Stock market falls after mixed data on the economy
item.description: The U.S. stock market is drifting lower on Tuesday following mixed data on the economy’s strength , which did little to clear uncertainty about where ...

item.title: When to Start Forecasting
item.description: Rachel Liverman of Glowbar and Kim Vaccarella of Bogg Bag discuss the moment they knew it was time to start forecasting.

item.title: The labor market’s holiday present for America: the highest unemployment in 4 years. It might be ‘noisy’ but the jobs just aren’t there
item.description: The November jobs report showed unemployment rose to a four-year-high.

item.title: Trump’s AI Executive Order Is Confusing Small Business Owners
item.description: Experts say if your company is using AI tools, you’re not off the hook in complying with local anti-discrimination laws.

item.title: IBM, AWS veteran says 90% of your employees are stuck in first gear with AI, just asking it to ‘write their mean email in a slightly more polite way’
item.description: Using AI as a “teammate” unlocks the true potential of AI productivity, according to Open Machine CEO Allie K. Miller.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley said Trump would halve the EV market by ending subsidies. Now he’s writing down $19.5 billion amid a ‘customer-driven’ shift
item.description: Months ago Farley said the EV market would shrink to 5% of the U.S. vehicle market.

item.title: Here’s Why the Founder of Bogg Bag Hates the Acronym ‘EBITDA’
item.description: EBITDA stands for ‘Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization.’ Kim Vaccarella hates the concept.

item.title: The Customer Isn’t Always Right—Here’s What We Did About it
item.description: What started out as a bad power dynamic can be flipped to equalize the relationship.
